sub_topic: Calculation of the electrical conductivity of a metal
message_1: Calculate the electrical conductivity of copper at room temperature given that its resistivity is 1.68 × 10^-8 Ω·m.
message_2:
Electrical conductivity (σ) is the reciprocal of resistivity (ρ). The formula to calculate electrical conductivity is:

σ = 1 / ρ

Given the resistivity of copper (ρ) is 1.68 × 10^-8 Ω·m, we can calculate the electrical conductivity as follows:

σ = 1 / (1.68 × 10^-8 Ω·m)

σ ≈ 5.95 × 10^7 S/m

The electrical conductivity of copper at room temperature is approximately 5.95 × 10^7 Siemens per meter (S/m).
